iati-activity.title: University of Strathclyde:Scotland Chikwawa Health Initiative
iati-activity.description: This project aims to improve maternal health services and reduce maternal and neonatal morbidity and mortality in the Chikwawa district, in southern Malawi. It focuses on families in remote and rural areas and enables them to gain access to integrated maternal and neonatal health services to reduce community based deliveries which present a higher risk. The project will train health centre staff and upgrade health centre equipment. In addition, activities will also include: education of community members to raise awareness and understanding of the value of maternal and neonatal health care; and the provision of maternal health shelters at the three health centres where women can stay in the late stages of pregnancy; the provision of 30 bicycle ambulances to support the work of health surveillance assistants across the Chikwawa district. It builds on an existing successful programme in the same district which received funding from the Scottish Government in 2008-09.
